repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Office of Development and Alumni Relations

physdesc.extent: 11 record cartons, 5 letter size document boxes, 5 half letter size document boxes, 1 legal size document box

did.abstract: This collection documents the Division of University Advancement's fundraising activities. Materials include promotional documents, development and fundraising plans, reports, publications, and audiovisual materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in seven series: Administrative records; Communications and marketing materials; Development research; Funded projects; Fundraising materials; Special events records; and Audiovisual materials.; and Born-digital materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains administrative and marketing records from the Department of University Advancement. Materials include promotional documents, development and fundraising plans, reports, and publications, as well as audiovisual materials and microfilm. Material in this collection ranges from 1857-2017, with the majority of material dating from 1980-2014.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is processed. The Administrative records, Communications and marketing materials, Development research, Funded projects, Fundraising materials, Special events records, and Audiovisual materials records series were processed by Archives and Reference Assistant Allison Maier in Summer 2019 under the supervision of Adrienne Pruitt, Collections Management Archivist. Materials were foldered, labeled, and in some cases rehoused in archival boxes. The subseries-level description, series-level description, and finding aid were updated at the time of processing. The digital materials were processed by Digital Archivist Margaret Peachy in Fall 2019.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The division of University Advancement oversees fundraising, alumni relations, and donor relations for Tufts University (Tufts University Fact Book 2017-2018). University Advancement has its roots in the mid-1970s expansion of the Resources division, when the division began to focus on managing funds and campaigns. Previously, external relations and fundraising had been overseen by different departments in a more ad hoc manner. By 1976, a Director of Fundraising had been hired under the Vice-President of Resources (Tufts University Fact Book 1976-1977). In 1978, the Development division was created, which oversaw alumni, community, and government relations and included a budget officer (Tufts University Fact Book 1978-1979). The following year, in 1979, the department was renamed University Development and continued to grow with the creation of new positions and reorganizations of department hierarchies (Tufts University Fact Book 1979-1980). In 2003, the division changed its name to University Advancement (Tufts University Fact Book 2003-2004).

controlaccess.subject: Advancement
Alumni and Alumni Relations
Curriculum and Instruction -- Scholarships, Fellowships, Awards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a variety of administrative records concerning alumni relations and fundraising, including development plans, project outlines, reports, accreditation manuals, marketing materials, and correspondence. Most records in this series concern the planning and development of specific fundraising projects in the second half of the twentieth century, such as the Second Century Fund, the Annual Fund, and the Engineering Building Fund. A significant portion of this series contains monthly progress reports on the Campaign for Tufts in the 1980s. A notable folder in this series is dedicated to Black alumni. Materials date from 1857-2011, with the majority dating from 1950-1990.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Boxes 1-6 in this series preserve their received arrangement. Boxes 7 and 8 are organized chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains marketing materials related to a variety of fundraising projects and events, including invitations, call for donations, fliers, and magazines (mostly the Tufts Blueprint). The types of material in this series overlaps with Special events records and Fundraising materials. Communications and marketing materials, however, tend to be broader in scope than Special events records and more concerned with promotional material. A notable type of record in this series is a list of the promotional content created by University Advancement during a given fiscal year. Each project is assigned a number and these numbers are then printed or written on most of the materials. Materials date from 2008-2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The organization of this series preserves its received arrangement. For each fiscal year, there is a record of the promotional content created by University Advancement in which each project is assigned a number. Up to the 2013 fiscal year, the material is organized by project number in descending order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The funded project records document the fundraising and grant-funding initiatives done on behalf of the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University. These records were compiled by George Kosar, former Associate Director of Corporate and Foundation Relations at the Fletcher School, and primarily reflect his actions and those of Stacy Neal, former Associate Director of the Center for Emerging Market Enterprises at the Fletcher School. Records date from 2006 to 2009 and include grant applications and background documents, correspondence, event information, clippings, and funding strategy reports. Entities mentioned include the National Institute of Justice (NIJ), the Smith Richardson Foundation (SRF), the Personnel Security Research Center (PERSEREC), and the Lynde and Harry Bradley Foundation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this series preserve their received arrangement.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to fundraising for Tufts, including planning materials, reports, gift planning brochures, and promotional materials. This series also includes some marketing materials relating to specific events such as invitations and fliers. The types of material in this series overlaps with Special events records and communications and marketing materials. Fundraising materials, however, tend to be broader in scope than Special events records and concerned with both promotional and internal material. Materials date circa 1930-2014, with the majority dating 1980-2014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this series are arranged chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

did.unittitle: Tufts Blueprint and Beyond Boundaries publications
Tufts Blueprint and Beyond Boundaries publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains marketing material related to university events, including fliers, invitations, and occasionally event programs. The types of material in this series overlaps with Fundraising materials and Communications and marketing materials. Special events records, however, tend to be more narrowly focused on the advertisement of events rather than general or targeted fundraising. Materials date from 2007-2013.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this series preserve their received arrangement and are organized chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains audiovisual materials of events and presentations held at Tufts. Events covered include the "Teaching at Tufts after 9/11" lecture by Sol Gittleman, 2004 commencement, and the dedication of the Granoff Music Center. The lecture by Sol Gittleman, the dedication of the Granoff Music Center, and the presentation concerning the Beyond Boundaries campaign exist in multiple formats. Materials date circa 2002-2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.
